website_summaries.verdict: The Netgear ReadyNAS NV+ v2 makes a decent NAS server for homes and small offices that need lots of storage space.
pros: The Netgear ReadyNAS NV+ v2 offers good performance, has a convenient drive bay design, and supports USB 3.0
Its X-RAID2 configuration makes it easy to manage the server's storage
cons: The Netgear ReadyNAS NV+ v2 is spartan in its features and noisy in its operation

customer_reviews.title: Great device, poor streaming
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace an aging RAID 0 home storage device and to make our files network available. After getting it set up, I find if I am reading and writing a bunch (say converting video from and to the NAS device), I lose connection (device crashes) after an hour or so. But that is ok, it's a NAS not a local storage device. But the big issue (why I didn't choose 5 stars) is because I cannot seem to stream videos/movies to my TV reliable. The movies start, get 1-6 minutes in and stop.
customer_reviews.author: Nate O.

customer_reviews.title: Hit and Miss
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 of these. I have experienced some problems getting the configuration to work with one but have since after many array rebuilds worked it out. One had inoperatve drive indicator lights out of the box. All in all not bad just not the type of quality I've come to expect from Netgear.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof
customer_reviews.text: Still running five years later, I put in 4 2Tb enterprise Hdd’s and have yet to have a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Gregor

customer_reviews.title: Great simple NAS
customer_reviews.text: A bit buggy... Locks up every so often... The MAC support for Time machine isn't all that workable. Gyg interface gives you true speed... Awesome support from Netgear, that is why I give it 4 not 3... For the price you get a great NAS...
customer_reviews.author: Catalina Briceno Murillo

customer_reviews.title: Works okay
customer_reviews.text: This works okay as a NAS, but the user interface is pretty buggy. I just hope the inner workings are more stable than the poorly written web interface. The interface is slow and lots of things don't work correctly or hang.
customer_reviews.author: S. Leiphart

customer_reviews.title: Almost...but no cigar
customer_reviews.text: The software for photos and music worked great; however, not quite as promised. It only worked on wifi as the current firmware (as of 03/2012) would not allow the iPhone and iPads to connect. Their support line was very nice, but even they were unable to get it working. Considering the main reason we targeted this device was iPhone/iPad access remotely it made the product an overpriced, external hard drive. Unfortunately we had to return for now, but maybe with the next update they'll work out the kinks.
customer_reviews.author: James B

customer_reviews.title: Shuts off very often. The most unreliable brand in ...
customer_reviews.text: Shuts off very often. The most unreliable brand in NAS devices. I had to root it to have low level access to be able to restart it when it's frozen. It gets frozen every month.
customer_reviews.author: Oleh Andrukh

customer_reviews.title: Great NAS
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly well. After installing this and setting up all of the backup jobs on the local PCs, this has worked great. Haven't had to give it a second thought.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen McLellan

customer_reviews.title: Failed after  one month and one week of use!
customer_reviews.text: Well, I'll see how Netgear handles my case. So far very dissatisfied with the unit. How can a brand new unit fail (does not power at all) after only 5 weeks of use!
customer_reviews.author: Rafa J

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: Everyone who have data they cant afford to loose should have one? Easy retrieve and saving of data, document, games , etc
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Unit Constantly freezes
customer_reviews.text: Could never get to work, constantly freezes when initiating transfer! Set up at least 5 different times, and used different cables, drives, etc. All have same result. Even downgraded firmware as suggested on forums. Still Same issue
customer_reviews.author: Robert T. Stern

customer_reviews.title: Solid trustworthy security for your files
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this since around the the January 1, 2012. So far this thing has been solid. I put two Seagate Green 2TB drive in to start then added a 3rd. It took about 24hrs for it to expand from 2 to 3 drives but read and writes have been sufficiently fast. I haven't fully explored all of its capabilities and available apps. But so far, this thing has done what I ordered it for.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Wright

customer_reviews.title: terrific product - performs well, good software, great manuf. tech support, 5YR warranty. also, newer models available...
customer_reviews.text: terrific product - performs well, good software, great manuf. tech support, 5YR warranty. also, newer models available with newer software for cloud services (RN10400 etc).
customer_reviews.author: Perspectech

customer_reviews.title: Reliability-Running non stop since 2012.
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Bought this back in 2012 it's been running non stop since then, only had one hard drive failure last year, no fault of the NAS. Drive was replaced, the RAID rebuilt data and was back up and running. Just has one quirk the web administration seems to work well with mozilla firefox only and takes a bit of effort to configure for different security access to various users but worth it for the reliability. P.S. this NAS was selected after extensive research because it's use was for a demanding business environment.
customer_reviews.author: Gleniss Ramkhelawan

customer_reviews.title: Handy addition to any home or small office
customer_reviews.text: Though my husband and I are still trying to figure out the learning curve to such a device (we're first timers) our big test run was a transfer of files and whatnot from my ancient laptop. Without having to deal with the frustration of emailing and carrying hard drives back and forth, the task was a breeze and the Netgear was very easy to access. The file sharing and storage is very handy for the multiple devices in our home, and I like just how small and space-friendly the device is. Where this ranks with similar products, we really have no idea, but we are happy with what this is offering.
customer_reviews.author: Emily J. Morris

customer_reviews.title: The only solution for your home...
customer_reviews.text: There are dozens of devices out there that can do "storage" and "RAID" but there are only a select few in the market place that not only give you storage but give users an experience with functional and easy to use applications to manage their data. This is the perfect device if it's your first NAS purchase or you're upgrading to a new NAS device...easy means you'll have more fun enjoying your stuff rather than wasting your time configuring.
customer_reviews.author: Mixonic

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful and Easy
customer_reviews.text: I have long wanted to acquire a raid backup system, but it seemed bulky and complicated. This system is relatively compact and was a breeze to set up. It can be used as a 2T hard drive or as a 1T with the other drive used as an automatic redundancy giving extra protection from failure. There are several open slots to add more drives if wanted. Just love it!
customer_reviews.author: Wendy G

customer_reviews.title: lacking software, but is on it's way.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this knowing that ftp support was not available. Being a Netgear device, I knew in time that they would add it as well as many other things. They have and I really like it. I currently have 4 3tb wd green drives in my nas, and it is working wonderful. My wife can watch a movie on her laptop, I can watch one on mine and even stream one to the ps3. Very capable box. The Dashboard seems slow to switch between fields, but is tolerable. Thanks again Netgear. One star due to backup licenses, I thought I could make numerous machines backup, but I missed that I guess.
customer_reviews.author: techmanty

customer_reviews.title: Nice Little Setup
customer_reviews.text: Im a IT for the company i work for. I purchased this device for our Outlook Archive. Then we had a new project of digitizing all our blue prints, We have well over 30,000 prints on it. With plenty of different documents. The device has a user friendly interface great security. I like the option with android to remote into it. I highly recommend this device to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: JDalton

customer_reviews.title: A non-techie person's review.
customer_reviews.text: I'm one of those people who have a huge amount of data (movies, pictures, music, audiobooks, etc) and I was looking for an alternative to the incredibly annoying online backup I'm currently using. This thing was...nonfunctional for me. A more advanced user than myself (I'm no idiot...I'm just not a computer science/tech person) could perhaps figure it out but the lack of decent manuals or guidance left me fairly clueless. In a phrase--if you are an end-user like myself who has no idea what some of the other reviewers are talking about in their reviews (acronyms and diagnostic tools), don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: Megan @ Tiny Orchard

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoying the new NAS. Very easy to set up. Did some test fails and lost no data. For an entry level device I am very pleased. Will most likely use it for years to come. Will be buying a new gigabit switch to replace my router soon.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel jock

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: The Enclosure works great. I've had no issues upgrading software. I also remote into the box without any hiccups. Xraid works. No issues period. I've added disks and they automatically get added. No Complaints here.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Cantin

customer_reviews.title: Centralized Storage for your home.
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be happier. I am able to share and store multiple files in one location without the need of a computer to be on all the time. Setup was a little tricky but was I got everything working it has worked like a charm. Setup is not for beginners or novices skill levels. If this was one two click and your up I would have given it all 5.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Netgear RND4000-200 ReadyNAS NV+ v2 Diskless 4-Bay/USB 3.0 Network Storage for Home/SoHo Users - Latest Generation
product_meta.description:
Style:ReadyNAS NV+, Diskless (0TB)FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 Netgear ReadyNAS Duo 



ReadyNAS NV+
RND4000 

STORE, SHARE AND PROTECT DATA AT HOME
Home media sharing has never been easier. In today’s connected world, home and office data is more valuable than ever. Smart small office and home users can now put data in one central location without sacrificing price, performance or quality. The ReadyNAS NV+ can even be used as a private cloud, securely delivering your own music, photos, videos, and documents, anywhere in the world. Equipped with the industry’s first USB 3.0 ports for blazing file transfer and backup rates.


The NETGEAR Difference * Peerless Simplicity

 * Painless Service and Support

Applications * Access music, videos and photos from anywhere 
   
   
 * Fast and easy backup target

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.2 out of 5 stars44 ratings3.2 out of 5 stars
